page.title: 13Employment
page.content: Some confusion exists as to whether{ {Rhuddlan}should be referred to as a town or a village.It is a community of over 4,000 inhabitants and is basically a dormitory settlement with a handfull of small local industries, mainly 'service type', providing {employment}which has otherwise to be sought elsewhere.While many people are able to find employment within reasonable proximity to the village, others travel considerable distances to work.In 1985, unemployment is a problem here, as it is nationally. A variety of {shops }is to be found, mostly along the High Street.While these appear to be adequately patronised, the neighbouring towns of Rhyl and Prestatyn with their numerous 'chain stores' are extremely popular with the local population.
